thread.title: What's on around Melbourne: gigs, theatre, dance, food, markets, expos and more
thread.title_full: What's on around Melbourne: gigs, theatre, dance, food, markets, expos and more

author: Sean Wilson
title: What's on around Melbourne: gigs, theatre, dance, food, markets, expos and more
text:
The Waifs. 
MUSIC  
COUNTRY
Bill Chambers, Justin Bernasconi, Cat Canteri, Dan Waters, the Weeping Willows and Bill Jackson gather to play originals as well as songs from artists who appeared on hit radio and television show The Louisiana Hayride . The music broadcast helped launch the careers of several stars, including Elvis Presley.
Sydney Chamber Opera will perform Fly Away Peter as part of a limited season for the Melbourne Festival. Photo: Supplied 
Tomorrow, 2.30pm, Caravan Music Club, 95-97 Drummond Street, Oakleigh, $20-$27, 9568 1432, caravanmusic.com.au 
Advertisement FOLK
The Waifs are back with a new album, their first since 2011 release Temptation . Beautiful You is the seventh full-length album from sisters Donna Simpson and Vikki Thorn, and Josh Cunningham. The band will be supported by singer, songwriter and guitarist Mia Dyson.
There will be sugar at the Cake Bake and Sweets Show, Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre. Photo: Supplied 
Today, 7pm, Palais Theatre, Lower Esplanade, St Kilda, $58-$63, 136 100, ticketmaster.com.au 
BIG BAND
The Cairo Club Orchestra turns back the clock for a '20s to '40s dance party in the suburbs. Driven by the talents of vocalist Nichaud Fitzgibbon, and featuring antique microphones and instruments, the band plays upbeat numbers from original vintage scores to get the audience up and onto the dance floor. Dining packages are available.
Plenty of bargains await buyers who journey on the fifth annual Garage Sale Trail. Photo: Supplied 
Tomorrow, 12.30pm, The Flying Saucer Club, 4 St Georges Road, Elsternwick, $23-$65, 9528 3600, flyingsaucerclub.com.au 
ART
Town Hall Gallery in Hawthorn transforms this afternoon as Echo Sets takes over the gallery spaces and foyer. A performance linked to the exhibition Eye Score: The Audible Image , Echo Sets is a sound art event featuring works by the Donkey's Tail, Michael Graeve, Dylan Martorell and Carmen Chan.
Monkey and companions come to life at the Geelong Performing Arts Centre. Photo: Justin Nicholas 
Today, 1.30pm, Town Hall Gallery, 360 Burwood Road, Hawthorn, free, 9278 4770, hawthornartscentre.com.au 
LIVE  
THEATRE
MASQUERADE
English artist Kit Williams' puzzle book Masquerade comes to life for two final performances as part of the Melbourne Festival. Adapted for the stage by Kate Mulvany and featuring music by Mikelangelo and the Black Sea Gentlemen, the play follows Jack Hare as he tries to deliver a message from the moon to the sun, with the unexpected help of a mother and son.
Today, 1pm and 7pm, tomorrow, 1pm and 6.30pm, Southbank Theatre, 140 Southbank Boulevard, Southbank, $25-$59, 136 100, festival.melbourne 
TENDER
A production of Nicki Bloom's debut play Tender closes at The Butterfly Club this weekend. Bloom's play first appeared at Belvoir St Downstairs in 2007. The play pieces together a series of events, as Sarah seeks to discover what happened in the gardens one fateful night.
Today, 7pm, tomorrow, 6pm, The Butterfly Club, Carson Place, off Little Collins Street, city, $28-$32, 9663 8107, thebutterflyclub.com 
OPERA
Sydney Chamber Opera perform Fly Away Peter for one final evening, as part of a limited season for the Melbourne Festival. Based on David Malouf's novel, the opera follows Jim Saddler, a young bird enthusiast from Queensland, as he travels from the idyllic coast to the trenches of the First World War. 
Today, 7.30pm, Fairfax Studio, Arts Centre Melbourne, 100 St Kilda Road, city, $48, 136 100, festival.melbourne 
DANCE
Masters of Choreography presents Arna Singleton's new work, a dance production inspired by the colour red. Directed and choreographed by Singleton, Seeing RED – a hip-hop tale features a cast of talented dancers including Singleton, Brandon Anderson, Colette Pengelley, Courtney Livock and Harry Hillcoat.
Today, 2pm, 5pm and 7.30pm, The Coopers Malthouse, 113 Sturt Street,
Southbank, $33-$40, 9685 5111, malthousetheatre.com.au  
FOOD  
EXPO
The Cake Bake and Sweets Show is back in Melbourne, offering a range of activities and attractions for anyone with a sweet tooth. Watch demonstrations from international bakers, decorators and chefs, including familiar faces from television, or take part in masterclasses and wander the displays at the weekend event. While you're there shop for the latest baking and cake decorating goods, or pick up some treats on the day.
Today and tomorrow, 10am-5pm, Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1 Convention Centre Place, South Wharf, $22-$30, cakebakeandsweets.com 
FESTIVAL
More than 60 exhibitors gather for the Williamstown Wine and Cheese Festival, including wineries, cider makers, and cheese and smallgoods producers.  Expect a grape stomping competition, cheesemaking demonstrations, children's activities and a live jazz band. Fill up on food on the day from Hellenic Republic, Ragusa, Altro Pizza and more. Tokens for tastings can be bought with admission. 
Tomorrow, 11am-6pm, Seaworks, 82 Nelson Place, Williamstown, $23-$37, wineandcheesefest.com.au 
RAMEN
New York and Tokyo ramen guru Ivan Orkin​ joins the team at Supernormal for Ramen Rave. Held in the lead-up to The Age Good Food Month, the event showcases Orkin's distinct dishes, including his signature shio ramen – a broth with pork belly chashu, toasted rye noodles and soy marinated egg. Andrew McConnell and his team will share their favourite snacks while local DJs Andras Fox and Zach PM set the atmosphere. 
October 28, 6pm-midnight, Supernormal, 180 Flinders Lane, city, $95, 9650 8688, supernormal.net.au 
ELSEWHERE  
MARKET
CITY
Find a bargain or 20 at the fifth annual Garage Sale Trail. The mass garage sale event sees households, community groups, schools, local businesses and whole streets host garage sales to sell unwanted items or raise money for charity. Pick up something special and meet some locals at any of the hundreds of garage sales taking place around Melbourne and regional Victoria. Visit the website to plan your personal trail.
Today, various times and venues, free, garagesaletrail.com.au 
BENTLEIGH
Arrive early at the Bentleigh Farmers' Market for the best fresh fish from Bass Strait Direct. The range from the popular seller regularly sells out. Benny Berries will be at the market with their ripe strawberries and Jonella Farm will have in-season asparagus for shoppers. Stop by French Island Organic Olive Oil for your local Victorian oil. Funds collected at entry go to the school garden program.
Today, 8am-12.30pm, Bentleigh East Primary School, 90 Bignell Road, Bentleigh East, $2 donation entry, vicfarmersmarkets.org.au 
FAMILY
Travel into the wonderful world of Curiosity before the show closes at Melba Spiegeltent. Produced by Circus Oz and performed by Dislocate, the show follows Alex, an imaginative young girl who enters the world of Curiosity through a tunnel in her toy box. By solving the problems of the inhabitants of Curiosity, Alex finds the solutions to her own problems. Final performances today.
Today, 10.30am and 12.30pm, Melba Spiegeltent, 35 Johnston Street, Collingwood, $18, circusoz.com 
WALK
Picturesque Albert Park Lake is the site for the Walk for Prems. The walk raises funds for the Life's Little Treasures Foundation, a charity for families of babies born sick or prior to 37 weeks' gestation. Participants can take part in the flagship five-kilometre walk, a timed 10-kilometre run or a five-kilometre run. Get to the finish line for a range of activities including amusement rides, music, a jumping castle and face painting. 
Tomorrow, 8am, Albert Park Lake, Albert Park, $20-$40, walkforprems.org.au 
OUT OF TOWN
Fans of the trippy '70s television series Monkey have one final day to catch new production Monkey… Journey to the West at the Melbourne Festival. Based on 16th century novel Journey to the West by Wu Cheng'en, the irrepressible Monkey and his companions come to life in a production co-directed by John Bell and Kim Carpenter, and featuring songs from musician Peter Kennard performed live on stage. Today, 1pm and 7pm, Geelong Performing Arts Centre, 50 Little Malop Street, Geelong, $29-$49, festival.melbourne 
EXPO
Motoring enthusiasts won't know where to look at Motorclassica, as more than 500 vehicles crowd the Royal Exhibition Building and its grounds this weekend. Rare, historic and exotic classic and collectible cars and motorcycles will be on display. This year the event marks 50 years of the Supercar, Shelby Mustang, Dino and the Bugatti Club Australia, and 70 years of MV Agusta​. A highlight of the expo is this evening's collector car auction. 
Today, 9am-9pm, tomorrow, 9am-5pm, Royal Exhibition Building, 9 Nicholson Street, Carlton, $20-$35, motorclassica.com.au
